page.title: 16SEVERN VALLEY STABLES
page.content: were opened in 1967.Prior to this it was a farm that kept pigs and cows.The farm is 13 acres and mostly given over to grazing.Now it is used to stable 20 horses and ponies.The horses are used for riding lessons and hunting.There are 6 brown,6 grey,7 bay,1 chestnut,2 dapple and 2 dun.They are all treated in a similar way.They are shod every six weeks.None of them have their hair cut except Edward who has his cut every 3 weeks.Their diet consists of oats,barley and other foods.Their ages vary from 1 to 23 and their heights vary from 10.3 to 17.2 hands high.They are all individuals and have different characters. In their stall they have wheat straw,sawdust and peat or shavings. The horses have to avoid all poisonous plants including buttercups, privet and bracken.
